item.title: Organizing your approach to a research study
item.description: Adapted from: Scott Emerson: http://emersonstatistics.com/courses/formal/b517_2012/analysis.pdf Andrew Gelman: http://andrewgelman.com/2014/01/14/advice-writing-research-articles/ Organizing your approach to a research study Before discussing with statistician State the overall goal of the study State the specific scientific aims and how they relate to the overall goal Current state of scientific knowledge Identify the expected outcomes that the study is designed to address Consider the available data and its relationship to the aims In consultation with statistician Refine scientific aims into statistical questions Identify the type of question Description/quantifying distributions, e.
